verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
anvicchantyo bhagavato
mārgaṁ gopyo 'vidūritaḥ
dadṛśuḥ priya-viśleṣān
mohitāṁ duḥkhitāṁ sakhīm

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; anvicchantyaḥ—searching out; bhagavataḥ—of the Supreme Personality of Godhead; mārgam—the path; gopyaḥ—the gopīs; avidūritaḥ—not far away; dadṛśuḥ—saw; priya—from Her beloved; viśleṣāt—because of the separation; mohitām—bewildered; duḥkhitām—unhappy; sakhīm—their friend.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: While continuing to search out Kṛṣṇa's path, the gopīs discovered their unhappy friend close by. She was bewildered by separation from Her lover.
